title: OOI Array Locations
caption: The Ocean Observatories Initiative (OOI) has hundreds of instruments collecting data every minute of every day from seven locations (arrays) throughout the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans. Some of the data in this activity was collected from the OOI Cabled Array, located in the northeastern area of the Pacific Ocean (red box).

title: OOI Cabled Array Map
caption: This is a detailed view of the OOI Cabled Array, indicating the location where the bottom pressure/bathymetry data was collected (3B in the red box).  Some data was collected from other seismic instruments operated by different government agencies (e.g., USGS) and universities (e.g., Oregon State University).

title: Instrument Locations on Axial Seamount
caption: Locations of the OOI Cabled Array instruments on Axial Seamount.

title: Ocean Bottom Seismometers
caption: Examples of the ocean bottom seismometers (OBS) that were placed on the Axial Seamount.

title: Bottom Pressure Sensor and Tilt Meter
caption: One of the instruments placed on Axial Seamount to record bottom pressure and tilt (surface angle).
